Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Fix for being unable to delete user account certificates" (#8303) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8302.

The page was missing anti-forgery token for ajax requests.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Fix for being unable to delete user account certificates" (#8303) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8302.

The page was missing anti-forgery token for ajax requests.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Can't delete user certificate" (#8302) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug
Individual account management page have trouble when trying to delete added certificates: clicking the delete button does nothing.

### To Reproduce
Add a certificate to an individual account. Try to delete it. See that nothing happens when you click the "delete" button (actually and ajax request is sent that fails).

### Expected behavior
Delete button should delete certificate.

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Unexpected error occurs when trying to install a package having invalid client policies in PM UI" (#10163) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Release-5.8.x\5.8.0.6914
VS Version: D16.8\30620.203 
OS Version: Windows-10-Enterprise-RS5
## Detailed repro steps
1. Create a clean machine OS: Windows-10-Enterprise-RS5. 
2. Create a new test certificate   `.\CreateTestCertificate.ps1 –AddAsTrustedRootAuthority`
3. Sign a package:  `NuGet.exe sign <PackageFilePath> -CertificatePath <PfxFilePath>`
4. Create a Console App (.Net Core) project, add required mode in Nuget.config file with no trusted signers:
  ```
<config>
     <add key="signatureValidationMode" value="require" />
  </config>
```
5. Reload the solution, update the package source to above package path, and install the package into a project in PM UI.

## Expected
Only error NU3034: signatureValidationMode is set to require, so packages are allowed only if signed by trusted signers; however, no trusted signers were specified occurred.
 
## Actual
Unexpected error occured as below screenshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71433406/96694287-db5bbf80-13ba-11eb-9df6-2f5f314f5404.png)
## Error Message
Severity | Code | Description | Project | File | Line | Suppression State
-- | -- | -- | -- | -- | -- | --
Error |   | Package restore   failed. Rolling back package changes for 'LPR32'. |   |   |   |  
Error | NU3034 | Package 'Package32   1.0.0' from source 'C:\Users\v-crchang\source\repos\Package32\Package32':   signatureValidationMode is set to require, so packages are allowed only if   signed by trusted signers; however, no trusted signers were specified. | LPR32 | C:\Users\v-crchang\source\repos\LPR32\LPR32\LPR32.csproj | 1 |  
Error | NU3034 | Package   'Microsoft.AspNetCore.App.Ref 3.1.2' from source   'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': signatureValidationMode is set to   require, so packages are allowed only if signed by trusted signers; however,   no trusted signers were specified. | LPR32 | C:\Users\v-crchang\source\repos\LPR32\LPR32\LPR32.csproj | 1 |  
Warning | NU3027 | Package 'Package32   1.0.0' from source 'C:\Users\v-crchang\source\repos\Package32\Package32': The   signature should be timestamped to enable long-term signature validity after   the certificate has expired. | LPR32 | C:\Users\v-crchang\source\repos\LPR32\LPR32\LPR32.csproj | 1 |  

## Notes
1. It starts to repro from Release-5.8.x\5.9.0.6896.
2. This issue **only** reproes on installing package into the project in PM UI.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Pushing a folder\ with symbols bypasses required -SymbolSource" (#10206) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Running this command, a snupkg is being pushed to the package endpoint, rather than the symbols endpoint.
`dotnet nuget push "repro\" --source "nugettest" --skip-duplicate`

> Pushing ConsoleApp12.1.0.13.snupkg to 'https://dev.nugettest.org/api/v2/package'...

Pushing to a specific set of files `repro\*.nupkg` or `repro\*.snupkg` does find the appropriate symbols endpoint as it applies. (except for this bug 

> Pushing ConsoleApp12.1.0.13.snupkg to 'https://dev.nugettest.org/api/v2/symbolpackage'...

@JonDouglas - should we officially support folder pushes? Our docs actually refer to "a path to a file" which doesn't make sense given we support wildcard/globbing.

Created after a discussion with @joelverhagen & @loic-sharma
/cc @zkat & @dominoFire

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Infer push endpoint by PackageType instead of extension" (#10205) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Using the file extension to determine whether symbols are being pushed is not reliable.

## Repro:
Pack a `.snupkg` then change the file extension to `.symbols.nupkg`.
Push the `.symbols.nupkg`.

## Expected:
On `push`
1. `-SymbolSource` is required parameter since this is a Symbol push.
2. Error that the symbols.nupkg is invalid (PackageType differs from extension).

## Actual:
> Pushing ConsoleApp12.1.0.13.snupkg to 'https://dev.nugettest.org/api/v2/package'...
  PUT https://dev.nugettest.org/api/v2/package/
  BadRequest https://dev.nugettest.org/api/v2/package/ 541ms
error: Response status code does not indicate success: 400 (Snupkg upload failed. Please use latest NuGet clients (v 4.9.0 or above) and a V3 endpoint to push Symbol packages. For details, refer https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/create-packages/symbol-packages-snupkg).

Created after a discussion with @joelverhagen & @loic-sharma 
/cc @zkat

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet UI] Grid columns for selecting project skipped with Tab but not with Shift-Tab" (#10202) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): PMUI

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate):  16.4

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

This is a problem for both NVDA and Narrator.

Right-panel -> Description field is not accessible by tabbing, and therefore isn't readable by any screen-reader.

Packages list, it only reads the Package Name, and does not read the Description. I'm not sure that we would want it to by default. But right now, there's no way to read a description at all.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet UI] Search dropdown does not show recent queries in NuGet Packages Manager window" (#10201) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Affected Branch: [27721.0.d15.8]
Affected Build: 15.8.0 Preview 2.0
Affected Product Language:

## Steps to reproduce:

1. Open any solution in VS Int Preview 

2. Open in menu Tools -> NuGet Package Manager -> Manage Nuget Packages for Solution 

3. Input search query to Search field

4. Click on Refresh button/any package/empty space to hide Search dropdown by losing focus from Search 

5. Clear Search field

6. Open Search dropdown


## Expected

last searched query appear first in dropdown

## Actual
last searched query does not appear in dropdown

## Note
query appears after selecting it in dropdown on search

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet UI] Search dropdown does not show recent queries in NuGet Packages Manager window" (#10200) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):  VS UI

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 4.x, 5.x

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: No

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Open any solution in VS Int Preview 

2. Open in menu Tools -> NuGet Package Manager -> Manage Nuget Packages for Solution 

3. Input search query to Search field

4. Click on Refresh button/any package/empty space to hide Search dropdown by losing focus from Search 

5. Clear Search field

6. Open Search dropdown



Expected: last searched query appear first in dropdown

Actual: last searched query does not appear in dropdown

Note: query appears after selecting it in dropdown on search

## Other suggested things

### Verbose Logs

Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Performance: Reduce UIDelays in GetPackageSpecsAsync for Legacy projects and non PR projects" (#9953) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
There are plenty of UI delays causes in this codepaths that affect codepaths at initialization and more importantly restore.

There are many related issues here, so consider this an epic if necessary. 

The goal here is to reduce the impact of legacy project on all NuGet operations. 

Issues: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1168242

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Copying content files into the specific folder." (#10199) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The problem is I need a way to copy content files into the specific folder of the project that is installing my NuGet package.

I can get a reference to it to show up in Visual Studio 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23568713/97584215-60ce1800-1a2a-11eb-9839-42e6aeee51e7.png)
But what I need is real files, not a referral link.
something like this
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23568713/97584478-aab6fe00-1a2a-11eb-8b88-3d59985b2fa4.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Output is wrapped at 80 characters on macOS when redirected" (#10198) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):

NuGet version (5.6.0.6489):

VS version (if appropriate):

macOS 10.15.7

```
$ mono --version
Mono JIT compiler version 6.12.0.93 (2020-02/620cf538206 Tue Aug 25 14:04:52 EDT 2020)
Copyright (C) 2002-2014 Novell, Inc, Xamarin Inc and Contributors. www.mono-project.com
```

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: Don't know

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

Good output:

```
$ nuget help
NuGet Version: 5.6.0.6489
usage: NuGet <command> [args] [options] 
Type 'NuGet help <command>' for help on a specific command.

Available commands:

 add               Adds the given package to a hierarchical source. http sources are not supported. For more info, goto https://docs.nuget.org/consume/command-line-reference#add-command.
[...]
```

Bad output:

```
$ nuget help | cat
NuGet Version: 5.6.0.6489
usage: NuGet <command> [args] [options] 
Type 'NuGet help <command>' for help on a specific command.

Available commands:

 add                                  Adds the given package to a hierarchical source. http source
                   s are not supported. For more info, goto https://docs.nuget.
                   org/consume/command-line-reference#add-command.

 config                               Gets or sets NuGet config values.

```

It doesn't turn out that bad for `nuget help`, but for other commands the output is just plain ugly:

```
$ nuget list -Source local-dotnet-feed -Prerelease | cat
Microsoft.iOS.Ref 14.1.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.47+sha.14df7017
1
Microsoft.iOS.Runtime.ios-arm 14.1.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.47+
sha.14df70171
Microsoft.iOS.Runtime.ios-x64 14.1.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.47+
sha.14df70171
Microsoft.iOS.Runtime.ios-x86 14.1.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.47+
sha.14df70171
Microsoft.iOS.Sdk 14.1.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.47+sha.14df7017
1
Microsoft.macOS.Ref 10.15.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.1332+sha.14d
f70171
Microsoft.macOS.Runtime.osx-x64 10.15.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.
1332+sha.14df70171
Microsoft.macOS.Sdk 10.15.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.1332+sha.14d
f70171
Microsoft.tvOS.Ref 14.0.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.708+sha.14df70
171
Microsoft.tvOS.Runtime.tvos-arm64 14.0.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows
.708+sha.14df70171
Microsoft.tvOS.Runtime.tvos-x64 14.0.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.7
08+sha.14df70171
Microsoft.tvOS.Sdk 14.0.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.708+sha.14df70
171
Microsoft.watchOS.Ref 7.0.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.708+sha.14df
70171
Microsoft.watchOS.Runtime.watchos-arm 7.0.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-wind
ows.708+sha.14df70171
Microsoft.watchOS.Runtime.watchos-x86 7.0.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-wind
ows.708+sha.14df70171
Microsoft.watchOS.Sdk 7.0.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.708+sha.14df
70171
```

compare to:

```
$ nuget list -Source local-dotnet-feed -Prerelease      
Microsoft.iOS.Ref 14.1.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.47+sha.14df70171
Microsoft.iOS.Runtime.ios-arm 14.1.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.47+sha.14df70171
Microsoft.iOS.Runtime.ios-x64 14.1.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.47+sha.14df70171
Microsoft.iOS.Runtime.ios-x86 14.1.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.47+sha.14df70171
Microsoft.iOS.Sdk 14.1.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.47+sha.14df70171
Microsoft.macOS.Ref 10.15.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.1332+sha.14df70171
Microsoft.macOS.Runtime.osx-x64 10.15.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.1332+sha.14df70171
Microsoft.macOS.Sdk 10.15.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.1332+sha.14df70171
Microsoft.tvOS.Ref 14.0.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.708+sha.14df70171
Microsoft.tvOS.Runtime.tvos-arm64 14.0.100-ci.dotnet-skip-all-of-aot-on-windows.708+sha.14df70171
```
